title: How to Make Kapustniky

steps.headline: In a large bowl, combine the flour, melted butter, powdered sugar, egg yolks, and salt together.
Dissolve the yeast in a small bowl with a little lukewarm milk along with a tsp sugar.
Stir in the remaining milk and knead the mixture together until you get a ball of smooth dough.
steps.description: Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise for 2 hours to double in size.

steps.headline: Remove the dark green outer layers of the cabbage and discard (or use them in a salad).
Heat about two tbsp oil in a stewing pot and add the cabbage.
steps.description: Cover and let simmer for 2 hours, stirring frequently.

steps.headline: When cabbage is tender, add the powdered sugar and cinnamon.
steps.description: Stir and remove from heat to cool.

steps.headline: Move the dough onto a board dusted with flour and roll out to some 3mm thick.
steps.description: Cut the dough into squares about the size of a palm and place teaspoon worth of filling in the middle of each.

steps.headline: Pinch the sides together and work your way around until the filling is covered.
steps.description: Repeat until all buns are made.

steps.headline: Form each of the buns into a circle shape and flatten them slightly with your palm.
Place the buns onto a greased baking sheet.
steps.description: Bake at 375F for about 15 minutes or until golden brown.

text: In a large bowl, combine the flour, melted butter, powdered sugar, egg yolks, and salt together.  Dissolve the yeast in a small bowl with a little lukewarm milk along with a tsp sugar. Add to the bowl. Stir in the remaining milk and knead the mixture together until you get a ball of smooth dough. Cover the dough with a damp cloth and let it rise for 2 hours to double in size. Remove the dark green outer layers of the cabbage and discard (or use them in a salad). Chop the remaining cabbage. Heat about two tbsp oil in a stewing pot and add the cabbage. Cover and let simmer for 2 hours, stirring frequently. When cabbage is tender, add the powdered sugar and cinnamon. Stir and remove from heat to cool. Move the dough onto a board dusted with flour and roll out to some 3mm thick. Cut the dough into squares about the size of a palm and place teaspoon worth of filling in the middle of each. Pinch the sides together and work your way around until the filling is covered. Repeat until all buns are made. Form each of the buns into a circle shape and flatten them slightly with your palm.  Place the buns onto a greased baking sheet. Bake at 375F for about 15 minutes or until golden brown. Dust with powdered sugar. Enjoy with coffee or tea.
